unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Is Your Dhinchak Playlist Drowning in Debt?**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Is Your Dhinchak Playlist Drowning in Debt?**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26th – Are your daily chai and samosa budgets shrinking faster than Ranbir Kapoor’s hairline? Blame it on the music streaming, bhai! Experts at IIT-Delhi have released a groundbreaking (and hilarious) study revealing that the average Indian spends a whopping Rs. 1500 a month on streaming services, mostly Bollywood bangers and devotional tunes.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth – Are your daily chai and samosa budgets shrinking faster than Ranbir Kapoor’s hairline? Blame it on the music streaming, bhai! Experts at I I T-Delhi have released a groundbreaking (and hilarious) study revealing that the average Indian spends a whopping rupee one thousand five hundred a month on streaming services, mostly Bollywood bangers and devotional tunes.

unnormalised: Turns out, listening to "Chaiyya Chaiyya" on repeat *does* come at a cost, literally. The study suggests folks are ditching the radio (remember those?) and racking up data charges quicker than you can say "Ek do teen."
normalised: Turns out, listening to "Chaiyya Chaiyya" on repeat *does* come at a cost, literally. The study suggests folks are ditching the radio (remember those?) and racking up data charges quicker than you can say "Ek do teen."

unnormalised: “It’s a vicious cycle,” chuckled Dr. Sharma, lead researcher. “They stream, their data runs out, they buy more data, they stream more…it's like a never-ending Bollywood song with slightly repetitive lyrics.”
normalised: “It’s a vicious cycle,” chuckled Doctor Sharma, lead researcher. “They stream, their data runs out, they buy more data, they stream more…it's like a never-ending Bollywood song with slightly repetitive lyrics.”

unnormalised: So, is your "Kal Ho Naa Ho" playlist actually causing a "Kal Ho Naa Ho" *for your wallet*? Maybe dust off that old cassette player, ya? Just a thought. And remember to sing loud enough so your neighbors can enjoy your choice of tunes!
normalised: So, is your "Kal Ho Naa Ho" playlist actually causing a "Kal Ho Naa Ho" *for your wallet*? Maybe dust off that old cassette player, ya? Just a thought. And remember to sing loud enough so your neighbors can enjoy your choice of tunes!
